document.masterDocTitle: Darwin wasps of the subfamily Pimplinae (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae) of Mexico: genera Neotheronia Krieger, Nomosphecia Gupta and Xanthopimpla Saussure

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Darwin wasps of the subfamily Pimplinae (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae) of Mexico: genera Neotheronia Krieger, Nomosphecia Gupta and Xanthopimpla Saussure

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neotheronia lineata
var. concolor Krieger 1905: 302
[ ♀ ♂ (ZMHB), Colombia, Ecuador, Peru , Brazil ( Rio Grande do Sul )].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pimpla lineata Smith, 1879
(junior homonym of
Bassus lineatus Fabricius, 1804
).

Neotheronia lineata var. lateralis Krieger, 1905
( Townes & Townes 1966: 32 ).

Neotheronia concolor taeniata Townes & Townes, 1966
(new name for
Pimpla lineata Smith, 1879
; Gauld 1991: 434 ).

Pimpla lineata

,

,

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. Krieger (1905: 302) described
N. pectoralis Krieger, 1905
as a form of
N. lineata Smith
from Peru . Type of this taxon is lost, and it was included as a subspecies of
N. concolor
by Townes ( Townes & Townes 1966: 32 ) and
Yu et al . (2016)
, but actually taxonomical status of
N. pectoralis
is unclear.
Variation. Mexican specimens have hind leg with tarsus often widely yellowish basally, sometimes only the apical tarsomere is black while remaining tarsomeres are yellow.

Distribution. Mexico (Nuevo León, Tamaulipas, San Luis Potosí, Nayarit, Querétaro, Veracruz, Guerrero, Morelos, Oaxaca, Tabasco, Chiapas), Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, Costa Rica, Panama, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Brazil.
First record from Honduras .

Biology. Reared from unidentified coocons of Lepidoptera infested also with
Zonopimpla carolinae Gauld
( Ichneumonidae : Pimplinae ), and probably is hyperparasitoid of this pimpline species ( Gauld 1991 ).
